document.title: Georgia Standards of Excellence CTEA Marketing

B582965A7A774662BA0EE550E5617502.description: Explain marketing and its importance in a global economy, as well as the struggles encountered by companies engaging in exporting, importing, and contract manufacturing.

EDC2CF8465F5479D8D086DE388A2B8CF.description: Explain why nations engage in international trade, as well as factors affecting trade such as culture, political structure, barriers to trade, currency fluctuations, comparative advantage, etc.

597BE6142974403789F488F57169FF11.description: Acquire foundational knowledge of international business and marketing concepts to understand the scope and impact on the economy.

A07390EE4E704AFE8C185FEF4229BBFC.description: Explain the relationship between customer service and channel management.

F56A6DCB1C914D70B68AE8F7C676568F.description: Identify the distinguishing characteristics of retailers, wholesalers, agents, and brokers.

B63B877D9D24473A91A9E88CC786E066.description: Analyze how distribution affects the cost of products.

BD6FCD0DA07F40B39E99CB9A72A6045B.description: Describe the use of technology in channel management.

4281ACF50CF046F9AC8DCD2CD184ECA3.description: Interpret common buying and shipping terms.

E74ED0068B544E01B135F54F130E6F87.description: Explain the marketing functions of transportation and storage.

DE010AA6B7D74BCFA5894958FAEC4F1D.description: Explain the nature of channels of distribution.

A872C495A4A44A90BD0931BC3AA2D2FF.description: Explain the nature and scope of channel management.

E914C9D7751B425BBBE22992EC907914.description: Utilize knowledge of distribution to manage supply-chain activities.

92A2009D7E274B47921E2A472751D458.description: Coordinate activities in the promotional mix.

35AC58B9207E48FCAA161D262B17FEBB.description: Explain the nature of a promotional plan.

57795530591E4E81A16F1B8FC4C7B770.description: Discuss internal and external audiences for public-relations activities.

D27F8CA708C94D6BABF1F013E06B86BC.description: Identify the types of advertising and social media and media costs.

655059560DDB462E9BB4A747DB4E3113.description: Understand promotional channels used to communicate with targeted audiences including types of advertising media, social media, digital media, word-of-mouth, direct marketing, sales promotion, trade-show/exposition participation, and publicrelations activities.

5A08EA2B43824AF490300CE8304FE200.description: Identify the elements of the promotional mix.

88D078C550BB45769A7170B92EE26643.description: Explain the role of promotion as a marketing function.

C4435CCF562548419F4142CF64D16481.description: Utilize promotional knowledge and skill for communicating information to achieve a desired marketing outcome.

135348828D3546BBA16287D72ACFB414.description: Analyze product information to identify product features and benefits.

353049C24D3D473386AEE963B705E027.description: Acquire product information for use in selling.

A580B2E346F24686B6F31C51920A35F6.description: Explain key factors in building a clientele.

3800A6846B19460CBD6E411C3C259617.description: Explain the nature of sales channels.

CB07A65651324220A7BA34886BFE47D4.description: Explain the role of customer service as a component of selling relationships.

FC297E2DA3274554AAACF24AC9D1E072.description: Explain factors and motivational theories that influence customer/client/business buying behavior.

B490D8CF853445288898FCC4D581205A.description: Explain the nature and scope of the selling function and the role of marketing as a complement to selling.

847888A65A944930BCB51E9311C7095E.description: Employ processes and techniques to sell goods, services and ideas.

B450BB5149DC4F989A84095242E9AE2D.description: Identify methods/techniques to generate a product idea.

44E4002BA0734670AE22F5A622480163.description: Explain the nature of corporate branding.

2576C3E37D1E4D60A4B1279AFA266B4F.description: Describe the nature of product bundling.

C015FD6721C44EF6A99BE3B776FDBA14.description: Explain the concept of product mix and product/service branding.

C1D48655E360486385FAFFC898B44989.description: Detail the procedure of positioning products/services.

EEBFA6D74A684BBE8CD96C295B412C46.description: Examine how businesses determine products/services to produce and sell.

352A7296D4A646B9B464A38D9B6B6BEC.description: Explain the nature and scope of the product/service management function.

E94A717921EC46AE803BDE4CB0C4C068.description: Employ processes and techniques to develop, maintain, and improve a product/service mix to utilize market opportunities.

40ACDD5282F24F1C822581FE6F9623CE.description: Identify the impact of product life cycles on marketing decisions.

0874D210B2AB4ED0BD4FF206F856C660.description: Compare and contrast markup, markdown, sale prices, and discount dollars and percentages.

3C3E7B8DCE0F435CB1DD7B4C7C712AB8.description: Distinguish between market share and market position as it relates to pricing.

5FCCE7429272434DAE1A71D7743F94E4.description: Explain the nature and scope of the pricing function.

4D34B9120AE64D72B2A2887E02849497.description: Utilize pricing strategies to maximize return and meet customer's perception of value.

2538BA805E40489FB8BE23832F06776E.description: Relate trends and limitations in marketing research including the impact of social media.

8731EF15BA8D47A6BABDB32C68AFD4D6.description: Demonstrate knowledge of the terms population, sample, bias, error, validity and reliability.

32A2B5EDA5F54A3D9AEF2E95F1635F36.description: Identify data monitored for marketing decision making.

074728163A1F4D748205D5C23EA30F3A.description: Describe data-collection methods (e.g., observations, mail, telephone, Internet, discussion/focus groups, interviews, scanners, and social media).

BF244F2683FC4620BDF3660FDF36E83E.description: Contrast the differences in primary and secondary data.

986CEA441B124538AB81A74D30A0B1C9.description: Explain the nature of marketing research.

9438DB63E4684A59B3FDCDD79137DA67.description: Describe the types of marketing research (advertising, product, market, and sales) and the differences between quantitative and qualitative data.

BC537D77D23E40EE8A6980C09CAC3950.description: Explain the nature and scope of the marketing information management function.

3C1AD7CA75F441478D8439321BF09878.description: Describe the need for marketing information.

7EA4D00B5AF44F1A96395954C2BDBED9.description: Acquire foundational knowledge of marketing information and research to understand the scope on business and marketing decisions.

DDD14F18CFCE4E60A5F22952E57FF802.description: Relate profit, cash flow, margin, and sales to the financial plan.

CA618190BA7744F4B393E43D40D9942E.description: Describe the various types of financial records that should be analyzed in making marketing decisions.

D2DBA44F732340AC8F237A80280C4CFE.description: Identify the types and purposes of credit.

BB623BA1838F46CD9BED09B63572BBDB.description: Describe the difference between business finance and personal finance.

3CF259A908E64CF7B0A457CD1A135618.description: Explain the role of finance in business.

857FCCD634DB4918B52BB823AE784633.description: Employ financial knowledge and skill to facilitate marketing decisions.

8D7C81619DA84926A91BB353D172DAED.description: Describe the functions of pricing in markets.

D152B50D38154EAF9E72197B4B249564.description: Explain the principles of supply and demand including elasticity.

858C68A518574B6185550DF42ECEB75A.description: Identify various measurements used to analyze an economy and how they relate to the marketing process.

E73B360753204F57BEDEF13700B93ADC.description: Explain how traditional, command, market, and mixed economic systems affect private ownership and the role of government.

5F66FD16E758403D823D1D72F2C84D57.description: Distinguish between various economic systems and the effects on what will be produced, how it will be produced, and for whom it will be produced.

1706D8EC4DAB4D0C9E278EF53C6466E0.description: Determine economic utilities created by business activities.

85C855104B234A97BBD5FA8579AE64BF.description: Explain the concept of economic resources.

8857D7CD5A724175A0871FA078318329.description: Distinguish between the concepts of economics and economic activities and distinguish between economic goods and services.

6C0F90E63866427AA7E5EAF75101D0BF.description: Explain the relationship between marketing and the economy.

4F69F0901D3A408A900C45ACA0B4CE06.description: Demonstrate an understanding of customer behaviors and the economic environment in which customers function.

86998394803049358053F0E42B56566C.description: Explain the importance of corporate social responsibility (CSR).

F67CEC7DA915402E88F5CB12A038FF37.description: Demonstrate an understanding of trends and developments in marketing.

442CEF0EA9EE414C9BAD040257B3299F.description: Relate the role of stockholders to management policies.

68982884A38142BCA6AB029E3209FDBE.description: Explain the role of business in society.

C6C4A49F77CA46A19D453BB10DDC2D2A.description: Implement, modify, and improve business and marketing systems to facilitate business activities.

B6DFB727EDEF40B2AC2AF583396A72FF.description: Relate the marketing concept to customers' needs and wants.

E28E2C0F0AE54EE3A8024A7BA6ABA651.description: Explain the concept of market, market segmentation, and market identification.

0E01B0FCAF6044BCA5FC9DC74134CA93.description: Explain the role of situational analysis in the marketing planning process.

FE4A0FD041104D4586AD29C34221F684.description: Explain the nature of marketing plans.

5BE4CB05B17246048CF019CA373D2537.description: Compare and contrast the effects of marketing activities.

52EEBE26765549939FA491AF0B06AC34.description: Describe marketing functions and related activities.

A6A81F2D5F264954BA08E447B2F67194.description: Explain the concept of marketing strategies and the marketing mix.

DFD28C3627D44F01BFCBE26D30945EC7.description: Acquire foundational knowledge of marketing concepts to understand the scope and impact of marketing on the economy.

DF3477FB0AC64E708DB9EA312BF6A467.description: Explain the requirements for success in the workplace including setting personal goals, assessing personal interests and skills, building and continually perfecting a personal brand, analyzing employer expectations, respecting the needs and opinions of all stakeholders, continually investigating career information, and differentiating between personal and business use of social media while determining the positive and negative aspects of both in the workplace.

EACDC8D338124889BA90E06B833B42DD.description: Explain the need for creative thinking and problem solving skills.

A9F6DC01D02549E2AD6ABC7E4DAC1D1D.description: Explain the nature and scope of teamwork and human relations including the nature of emotional intelligence, self-esteem, personal biases and stereotypes, personal strengths and weaknesses, desirable personality traits important to business, stress management, negotiation and conflict-resolution skills, consensus-building skills, and the impact of political relationships within an organization.

2F91FD7138E24609AF2A74F600D5CE54.description: Explain all aspects of the communication process and how they interrelate including mastering effective communication, utilizing company resources to ascertain policies and procedures, making oral presentations, editing and revising written work consistent with professional standards, and writing professional e-mails, business letters, informational messages, inquiries, persuasive messages, press releases, executive summaries and simple written reports.

7C6CDB7205CB4F68964AC1EB73F1EA18.description: Obtain an understanding of marketing, business, and management terminology.

10031EBA3D674897926C8F0B55A7C37F.description: Demonstrate an understanding of concepts, strategies, techniques and systems used in communication, teamwork, human relations, problem solving, critical thinking, personal branding and career development (areas commonly referred to as "soft skills").

5BC1107607DC4978B0D09C98CE6584A7.description: Present a professional image through appearance, behavior and language.

4BE0AFE763C741418F1AC006904631DB.description: Apply the appropriate skill sets to be productive in a changing, technological, diverse workplace to be able to work independently and apply team work skills.

3AE7165E685F4BE8961ED357FC5D9EE7.description: Model work readiness traits required for success in the workplace including integrity, honesty, accountability, punctuality, time management, and respect for diversity.

A0F2FA3A7F4F47B6B9E6C9EF92997212.description: Exhibit critical thinking and problem solving skills to locate, analyze and apply information in career planning and employment situations.

3DD594255FD2401DABF5BFBFD99D3552.description: Demonstrate creativity by asking challenging questions and applying innovative procedures and methods.

CD595E8998BE4702B1A633742CEA5371.description: Communicate effectively through writing, speaking, listening, reading, and interpersonal abilities.

519CD1B44AA24E9396D6FEEA9A48A0A4.description: Demonstrate employability skills required by business and industry.
